Articles.Content:
SCP-1183, or soon to be anyway - if my account is accepted. The article is called 'Roadkill'. The object is a European Red Fox which appears to have survived being hit by a motorcycle at some point. It actively seeks out roads, especially intersections, where it can be hit by high-speed vehicles. However, despite high speed impacts [including the impact of being thrown clear] SCP-1183 suffers no injuries. The occupants of the vehicle that hits it, however, are killed by whatever injury should have killed SCP-1183.

Non-lethal injuries do not have this effect. The effect extends to operators and observers of the operators of remote controlled craft too, as the late Researcher Lamprey and Research Assistant Kitzani sadly discovered.

Eh... it's just another thing what kills you. There are already so many of those. It's a good idea, but change its effect.

Maybe the person who hit the animal will have memories of a loved one being hit and killed by a car. The subject would have no memories of that person after the time that they were killed, despite the loved one not being dead.
